cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi (125 km) south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest overnight, then turning north toward the south-central Louisiana coast with inland progression up the Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City–Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle, and Intracoastal City to Cameron, LA. Tropical Storm Watch: east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle, LA. Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, LA; Lake Pontchartrain and Maurepas; Intracoastal City to Cameron, LA. Storm-surge warnings for Intracoastal City LA to Biloxi MS and Lake Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts along the Louisiana coast and adjacent Mississippi coast; secondary impacts possible along the extreme upper Texas coast including Port Arthur/Beaumont.
weather_observation.wind: 30–40 mph sustained winds with higher gusts possible Saturday as outer bands clip the upper Texas coast; only a 36 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds at Port Arthur/Beaumont.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible (<3 ft) on Sabine-Neches waterway; no official surge warning for Texas coast at this time.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Saturday through early Sunday with localized higher totals, creating flooding risk in low-lying port facilities and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in rain bands and periods of reduced visibility from squalls may affect cargo handling and vessel movements.
